feed.title: Category: Webservice, | Application Integration With IBM ESB

entry.title: WebService Develpment Using HTTP Node
entry.content:
WebService Provider with HTTP Node

I’ll try to show tedious webservice provider development using HTTP node. in this example I’ve tried to expose webservice over SOAP protocol. since we’ve to construct(write tedious codes) for multiple namespaces for the envelope and subsequent nodes, it’s more prefered to use SOAP node which abstracts out these multiple lines of code and hence enables us to focus on business needs.

https://s3.amazonaws.com/abjoy/wmb/http_webservice_node/pic1.jpeg" width="800" height="1200">

https://s3.amazonaws.com/abjoy/wmb/http_webservice_node/pic2.jpeg" width="800" height="1200">

https://s3.amazonaws.com/abjoy/wmb/http_webservice_node/pic3.jpeg" width="800" height="1200">

In this example, bank user tries to login into his bank account and sees his account information. the first data he enters: username, password are credentail for webservice request. and detailed information; customer name, checking account and saving account are returned as webservice response. key note ! port number 7080 is the default for listening webservice request.
